title: I am 14 years old. What classic literature should I read? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m 14 too! Non-fiction: Science: A brief history of time: Stephen Hawking - this book is simply a revelation.An Astronaut's guide to life on earth: Chris Hadfield - a scintillating account of NASA veteran and musician Chris HadfieldThings to make and do in the fourth dimension: Gibbons: funny, witty, and wholly immersive.What if? : Randall Munroe: Light reading, up roaringly funny, jaw dropping, great for a non-reader.Biography: Surely you're joking Mr. Feynman: Richard Feynman autobiography, hilarious, relatable, and engrossingly interesting.Elon Musk: Ashlee Vance: Gripping, inspiring.accidental billionaires: Ben Mezrich: Dramatic, addictive, marvellous account of Mark Zuck and Ed SaverinGeneral: Freakonomics: gets you thinking. revelation.Outliers: Malcolm Gladwell: AN ABSOLUTE REVELATION, work of a genius.Zero to One: Peter Thiel: Insightful advice on creating a startup.Fiction: Hitchhikers Guide to The galaxy: Trilogy in four parts. : Douglas AdamsGame of Thrones (Ask your parents): Goerge R. R. MartinHow I braved Anu Aunty (Varun something)The Alchemist: Paulo ColehloThat’s it! You could make this your summer reading list.

Thanks for the A2A David Kvitaishvili! =) To be honest I think our tastes might be too different for me to give any really great recommendations. The closest things I could recommend are books you're probably already familiar with. Imre Kertesz - "Fatelessness"Douglas Adams - "The Hitchhiker’s Guide to the Galaxy"J.D Salinger - "Catcher in the Rye"E.M Forster - "A Room with a View" I suggest you go to Goodreads, put together a list of the books you've read and then you'll get some suggestions based on them on the right hand side. I've added 200+ great books based on my initial list of 50 great books. It's a great tool and interacting with other readers who share your interests is super easy. Have an awesome & creative day! =)
